node.statement: (Exponential integrability of Wick powers under mu) Under the Phi^4_3 measure mu, for any smooth test function f on T^3 and any Wick power :phi^k: (k = 1,2,3), the smeared quantity <f, :phi^k:> has finite exponential moments: E_mu[exp(alpha <f, :phi^k:>)] < infinity for all alpha in R. For k=1 (linear functional), this follows from sub-Gaussian tails of the Phi^4_3 measure (Barashkov-Gubinelli). For k=2,3, this follows from the Nelson hypercontractivity estimates adapted to the Phi^4_3 setting, using the fact that the quartic interaction provides stronger-than-Gaussian decay.
